title: ‘We want our jobs!’ Thousands march against Italian labor reforms (VIDEO)
author: RT
summary:
Some 40,000 protesters took to the streets of Rome on Friday, as Italy was gripped by protests against Prime Minister Matteo Renzi's reforms. Demonstrations turned violent in Milan and Turin as protesters clashed with police.
Read Full Article at RT.com

title: Big break: Russians search for cat who sneaked $1,000 feast at seafood shop
author: RT
summary:
A ginger tomcat who broke into a closed shop at Vladivostok international airport and treated himself to seafood worth over $1,000 has gone missing. The fishy story has sparked a media frenzy – both in Russia and beyond.
Read Full Article at RT.com

title: Six released Guantanamo detainees ‘happy to be’ in Uruguay
author: RT
summary:
Six former US detainees, who have never been charged, are beginning their new life as refugees in Uruguay. They arrived on Sunday and have given their first comments to the press to say they are happy to be there.
Read Full Article at RT.com

title: Redeployment of nukes to Europe won’t increase US security – Moscow
author: RT
summary:
The possible redeployment of nuclear cruise missiles to Europe and other military steps mentioned by a US official over Russia's alleged violation of a crucial arms control treaty won't add to US security, but will increase tension, Moscow said.
Read Full Article at RT.com

title: Ebola stymies Xmas: Sierra Leone bans festive celebrations
author: RT
summary:
Sierra Leone has banned any public celebrations of Christmas and the New Year over the spread of the Ebola virus that has affected thousands of the population. The military will strictly monitor the ban.
Read Full Article at RT.com

title: Snowden, nein! High court foils opposition attempt to bring whistleblower to Berlin
author: RT
summary:
A German court has rejected a bid by opposition parties to bring ex-NSA contractor Edward Snowden to Berlin to testify about the US agency’s intelligence activities in Germany before a parliamentary committee.
Read Full Article at RT.com

title: Dozens of graves, mostly Russian and Serbian, damaged by vandals in Sydney (VIDEO)
author: RT
summary:
At least 76 graves, mostly Russian and Serbian, have been damaged by vandals in a Sydney cemetery. The incident, already condemned by Moscow, happened a day before Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko’s official visit to Australia.
Read Full Article at RT.com

title: US destroying foundation of cooperation: Moscow slams ‘anti-Russian’ Ukraine bill
author: RT
summary:
Russia’s Foreign Ministry has decried the US Senate-backed Ukrainian support bill as “anti-Russian” in a statement released on Friday evening. It says that Washington is seeking to “destroy cooperation” between the two nations.
Read Full Article at RT.com

title: Russia targeted by another large-scale cyber espionage campaign – Kaspersky Lab
author: RT
summary:
Russian companies in oil, finance, military, and other sectors – as well as the country’s embassies abroad – have become the primary targets of a new espionage campaign, labeled ‘Cloud Atlas’ by global information security powerhouse Kaspersky Lab.
Read Full Article at RT.com

title: Euthanasia one step closer? France to debate draft law
author: RT
summary:
The French parliament is set to debate draft legislation allowing doctors to keep terminally ill patients sedated until death. The bill is supported by President Francois Hollande, who included the controversial euthanasia issue on his election agenda.
Read Full Article at RT.com

title: Spain passes strict anti-protest law
author: RT
summary:
Spain has narrowly voted in an anti-protest law, which the government argues will ensure public security but opponents say will restrict civil liberties.
Read Full Article at RT.com

title: ​Indonesian editor ‘amazed’ by blasphemy accusations over ISIS cartoon
author: RT
summary:
The chief editor of Indonesia’s oldest English daily has been accused of blasphemy after the paper published an anti-Islamic State cartoon. The editor denies any wrongdoing and is “amazed” at the accusations, spurred by complaints from Islamic groups.
Read Full Article at RT.com

title: Retraining reservists and rearming! Baltic countries got bellicose over ‘Russian threat’
author: RT
summary:
European countries bordering the Baltic Sea are competing to express their concerns over Russian military activities of in the region. Their actions vary from inviting Americans troops for a permanent stay to retraining reservists and rearming.
Read Full Article at RT.com

title: E. Ukraine ceasefire finally ‘real’, both sides confirm
author: RT
summary:
The ceasefire in Ukraine is actually being implemented, and both sides of the conflict have acknowledged this in a rare demonstration of accord after months of mutual accusations.
Read Full Article at RT.com

title: ISIS leader says US prisons in Iraq led to creation of terrorist organization
author: RT
summary:
A leading member of the Islamic State has revealed the group could never have been formed without the help of the US. American prison camps in Iraq gave the Islamists the perfect opportunity to meet and plan their eventual rise to power.
Read Full Article at RT.com

title: Germany wants to send more troops to help Kurds fight ISIS
author: RT
summary:
The German government wants to send over 100 troops to train Kurds fighting against the Islamic State in northern Iraq. Should the plan be approved by the parliament, it would require changes in the supreme law to reverse the strict military policy.
Read Full Article at RT.com

title: Israel threatens to review cooperation with Swiss over Geneva debate on PA territories
author: RT
summary:
Switzerland has riled Israel over its decision to host a meeting of signatory states to the Geneva Conventions, expected to slam Israel for its actions in the "occupied territories." Israel pledged to reconsider its future cooperation with the Swiss.
Read Full Article at RT.com

title: Low education budgets, universities ‘in ruins’ see thousands protest in France
author: RT
summary:
Thousands of French university staffers and students have marched to protest low education budgets and universities’ facilities that are “literally in ruins.”
Read Full Article at RT.com

title: Celibacy could cause child abuse, landmark Catholic report admits
author: RT
summary:
Obligatory celibacy could have contributed to child sex abuse in the Catholic Church, a group of Australian archbishops has admitted, becoming the first-ever Catholic institution to publicly acknowledge the potential link.
Read Full Article at RT.com

title: Move your arsenal! US tanks, APCs, Humvees roll through Latvia (VIDEO, PHOTOS)
author: RT
summary:
A freight train carrying a whole column of American armored vehicles has been caught on camera in Latvia. Dalbe Railway Station, where the train was reportedly spotted several days ago, is less than 300km from the Russian border.
Read Full Article at RT.com
